ul.li: sys-kernel/gentoo-dev-sources is the only supported kernel sources on Gentoo/AMD64
GRUB is only available in static form
A dual 32-bit/64-bit environment is possible, with some limitations
High-end ATI cards must use the vesafb driver. No 64-bit 3D drivers are available
NEVER add x86 or ~x86 to your ACCEPT_KEYWORDS
Pass idle=poll to the kernel at boot if you are getting kernel panics
MPT Fusion SCSI cards require iommu=merge to be passed to the kernel at boot time
Only channels 1 and 2 work on the Silicon Image 3114 SATA controller
You don't need to put -march=k8 in your CFLAGS since there is only one x86-64 CPU at the moment
mmx, 3dnow, sse and sse2 USE flags are ignored since all AMD64 processors support them
You must have IA32 Emulation turned on in Executable File Formats in your kernel for 32-bit emulation (and 32-bit chroot) to work
